channel.title: Anabasis (The March of the Ten Thousand) — Modern Simple on Dual Classics
channel.description: Recent content in Anabasis (The March of the Ten Thousand) — Modern Simple on Dual Classics

item.title: Chapter 1: Cyrus and the King
item.description: Cyrus wants to be king.

item.title: Chapter 2: March to Celaenae
item.description: Friends join Cyrus. The army grows.

item.title: Chapter 3: The Soldiers' Revolt
item.description: The soldiers refuse to march and Clearchus must choose between Cyrus and his men.

item.title: Chapter 4: Through Syria to the Gates
item.description: Cyrus marches through Syria and faces fortified passes on his way to confront the king.

item.title: Chapter 5: Through the Desert
item.description: The army crosses the Arabian desert, hunting wild animals and struggling to find food.

item.title: Chapter 6: The Traitor Orontas
item.description: A Persian noble tries to betray Cyrus but is caught and put on trial.

item.title: Chapter 7: The King's Army Approaches
item.description: The army prepares for battle as the king’s forces draw near.

item.title: Chapter 8: The Battle Begins
item.description: The king’s army approaches and the Greek soldiers prepare for battle.

item.title: Chapter 9: The Death of Cyrus
item.description: The story of Cyrus’s death and remembrance of his noble character.

item.title: Chapter 10: The March Continues
item.description: The army releases prisoners to move faster and marches with better discipline.

item.title: Chapter 11: After Cyrus (Book II, Chapter 1)
item.description: The Greek leaders decide their next steps after Cyrus’s death and face demands from the king.

item.title: Chapter 12: The Alliance and Night March (Book II, Chapter 2)
item.description: The Greeks join forces with Ariaeus and begin their dangerous march through enemy territory.

item.title: Chapter 13: The King's Truce (Book II, Chapter 3)
item.description: The Greeks negotiate a truce with the king and cross difficult terrain while searching for food.

item.title: Chapter 14: Waiting and Worrying (Book II, Chapter 4)
item.description: The Greeks grow uneasy as they wait with Ariaeus while Persian visitors ignore them.

item.title: Chapter 15: Through the Desert to the Gates (Book II, Chapter 5)
item.description: The army struggles through the Arabian desert, losing many animals to starvation.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Betrayal and Death of Clearchus (Book II, Chapter 6)
item.description: The Greek commanders are betrayed, captured, and executed by the king.

item.title: Chapter 17: Xenophon's Dream (Book III, Chapter 1)
item.description: Xenophon, a thoughtful Athenian, has a prophetic dream as the Greeks face their darkest hour.

item.title: Chapter 18: The New Leaders Rise (Book III, Chapter 2)
item.description: After the betrayal, new leaders emerge to rally the Greek soldiers with speeches of courage and honor.

item.title: Chapter 19: Mithridates the Spy (Book III, Chapter 3)
item.description: A Persian named Mithridates pretends to help but is revealed as a spy for the king.

item.title: Chapter 20: Ancient Cities and Tissaphernes Returns (Book III, Chapter 4)
item.description: The Greeks discover mysterious abandoned cities and face Tissaphernes once again.

item.title: Chapter 21: Burning Villages and a Clever Plan (Book III, Chapter 5)
item.description: Tissaphernes burns villages while the Greeks devise an ingenious river crossing plan.

item.title: Chapter 22: Through the Carduchian Mountains (Book III, Chapter 6)
item.description: The Greeks struggle through steep passes while Carduchians attack from the heights.

item.title: Chapter 23: The Snowstorm (Book III, Chapter 7)
item.description: A deadly snowstorm hits until Xenophon rallies the army with hope and practical steps.

item.title: Chapter 24: River Crossing and New Hope (Book III, Chapter 8)
item.description: The army builds rafts to cross a wide river and finds renewed hope.

item.title: Chapter 25: Night Climb into Carduchia (Book IV, Chapter 1)
item.description: Cheirisophus leads light troops and Xenophon the heavy soldiers into steep Carduchian passes.

item.title: Chapter 26: Strong Lines on the Summit (Book IV, Chapter 2)
item.description: Xenophon and Cheirisophus steady the army; the Carduchians fall back.

item.title: Chapter 27: Book IV, Chapter 3
item.description: Into Armenia; distances, rivers, and a cautious treaty with Tiribazus.
